title: Prafulla Kumar Sen
text:
Prafulla Kumar Sen (died 24 March 1942), also known as <a href="Swami">Swami</a> Satyananda Puri, was an Indian <a href="Indian%20independence%20movement">revolutionary</a> and philosopher. Puri, had in his youth taught <a href="Oriental%20philosophy">Oriental philosophy</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Calcutta">University of Calcutta</a> and later at <a href="Rabindranath%20Tagore">Rabindranath Tagore</a>'s <a href="Visva-Bharati%20University">Visva-Bharati University</a> at <a href="Santiniketan">Santiniketan</a>. Encouraged by Tagore, he arrived in <a href="Thailand">Thailand</a> in 1932, and in 1939, he founded the <a href="Thai-Bharat%20Lodge">Thai-Bharat Lodge</a>, a cultural forum. Arriving in Thailand, Puri was appointed a professor at the <a href="Chulalongkorn%20University">Chulalongkorn University</a>, lecturing in ancient Indian and Thai languages, and is said to have mastered the <a href="Thai%20Language">Thai Language</a> in six months and went on to translate a number of Indian philosophical works and biographies, including the <a href="Ramayana">Ramayana</a> and biographies of <a href="Gandhi">Gandhi</a> to Thai. His literary work eventually was more than twenty volumes.
At the onset of <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> in 1939, Puri also came to form the <a href="Indian%20National%20Council">Indian National Council</a> that, along with <a href="Giani%20Pritam%20Singh">Giani Pritam Singh</a>'s <a href="Indian%20Independence%20League">Indian Independence League</a>, was instrumental in stimulating the evolving Japanese interest in supporting armed Indian resistance for the <a href="Indian%20freedom%20movement">Indian freedom movement</a>. Singh and Puri were amongst the first people to negotiate with <a href="Fujiwara%20Iwaichi">Fujiwara Iwaichi</a> and the <a href="F%20Kikan">F Kikan</a> regarding Japanese policies in an effort to obtain a commitment about the support of the movement that ultimately saw the foundation of the <a href="Indian%20Independence%20League">Indian Independence League</a> and the <a href="Indian%20National%20Army">Indian National Army</a>. Both Puri and Pritam Singh were among the Indian delegates killed in a plane crash en route to the <a href="Tokyo%20conference">Tokyo conference</a> in March 1942. The Swami Satyananda Puri foundation was established by the <a href="Thai-Bharat%20Cultural%20Lodge">Thai-Bharat Cultural Lodge</a> in 1942 in his honour. The SSPF library today is a reference library that houses many old and rare Indian texts. The foundation is also involved in promoting work on Indian culture, especially on the <a href="Ramayana">Ramayana</a>.
